1
2-- | Token line and clause.
3
4module Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token.Clause
5  ( -- * Token line
6    TokenLine,
7    tokenLinesBy,
8    tokenLines,
9    tokenLinesTextAssert,
10    readTokenLines,
11  
12    -- * Token clause
13    TokenClause,
14    tokenClauses,
15    readClauses,
16    readClauseTokens,
17
18    -- * Abbreviation
19    toks,
20    printToks,
21    toksPrint,
22    clausePrint,
23  ) where
24
25import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture               as O
26import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base                   as B
27import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Symbol          as S
28import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token.Clip      as S
29import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token.Rel       as S
30import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token.Section   as S
31import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token.Token     as S
32import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token.Utility   as S
33import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Message           as Msg
34
35
36-- --------------------------------------------  Token line
37
38-- | Token list on a line.
39type TokenLine t = B.CodeLine S.TToken t
40
41-- | Tokenize with given scanner.
42tokenLinesBy
43    :: (B.ToLines i, O.Textual t, S.ToTermName t)
44    => S.Scanner t       -- ^ Section scanner
45    -> B.IxIOPoint       -- ^ I/O point of input code
46    -> i                 -- ^ Input code
47    -> [TokenLine t]     -- ^ Result lines of tokens
48tokenLinesBy scan = B.codeScanUp $ scan changeSection
49
50-- | Tokenize relational section.
51tokenLines :: (B.ToLines i, O.Textual t, S.ToTermName t) => B.IxIOPoint -> i -> [TokenLine t]
52tokenLines = tokenLinesBy S.scanRel
53
54-- | Tokenize text.
55tokenLinesString :: (B.ToLines i, O.Textual t, S.ToTermName t) => B.IxIOPoint -> i -> [TokenLine t]
56tokenLinesString = B.codeScanUp $ S.scanRel changeSection
57
58-- | Tokenize lazy bytestring.
59tokenLinesTextAssert :: (B.ToLines i) => B.IxIOPoint -> i -> [TokenLine String]
60tokenLinesTextAssert = tokenLinesBy S.scanTextAssert
61
62changeSection :: (O.Textual t, S.ToTermName t) => S.ChangeSection t
63changeSection name =
64    case O.tString name of
65      "rel"      -> just S.scanRel
66      "note"     -> just S.scanNote
67      "end"      -> just S.scanEnd
68      "license"  -> just S.scanLicense
69      "local"    -> unsupp "local section"
70      "attr"     -> unsupp "attr section"
71      "text"     -> unsupp "text section"
72      "doc"      -> unsupp "doc section"
73      "data"     -> unsupp "data section"
74      _          -> Nothing
75    where
76      just scan   = Just $ B.codeChange $ scan changeSection
77      unsupp n    = Just $ sectionUnsupported n
78
79sectionUnsupported :: (O.Textual t) => String -> S.TokenScanMap t
80sectionUnsupported msg r@B.CodeScan { B.scanInput = cs } = B.codeUpdate O.tEmpty tok r where
81    tok  = S.unknownToken cp cs $ Msg.unsupported msg
82    cp   = B.scanCp r
83
84-- | Read token lines from file.
85readTokenLines :: (O.Textual t, S.ToTermName t) => FilePath -> B.IOAb [TokenLine t]
86readTokenLines path =
87    do file <- B.readBzFile path
88       bz   <- B.abortLeft $ B.bzFileContent file
89       return $ Right $ tokenLines (B.pathIxIO path) bz
90
91
92-- --------------------------------------------  Token clause
93
94-- | Code clause of tokens.
95type TokenClause t = B.CodeClause S.TToken t
96
97-- | Convert token lines into token clauses
98tokenClauses :: [TokenLine t] -> [TokenClause t]
99tokenClauses = map clause . split where
100    clause ls = B.CodeClause ls $ list ls
101
102    list :: [TokenLine t] -> [S.TToken t]
103    list = concatMap $ S.sweepToken . B.lineTokens
104
105    split :: [TokenLine t] -> [[TokenLine t]]
106    split = B.gather B.splitClause . map indent . B.omit blank
107
108    blank :: TokenLine t -> Bool
109    blank = all S.isBlankToken . B.lineTokens
110
111    indent :: TokenLine t -> (B.IndentSize, TokenLine t)
112    indent = B.lineIndentPair tokenIndent
113
114-- | Indent level.
115tokenIndent :: S.TToken t -> Int
116tokenIndent (S.TSpace _ n) = n
117tokenIndent             _  = 0
118
119-- | Read clause list from file.
120--
121-- Content of file @clause.txt@:
122--
123--   > **
124--   > **  This is an example file for 'readClauses' function
125--   > **  defined in Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token.Clause module.
126--   > **
127--   > 
128--   > aa
129--   > bb
130--   >  cc
131--   > 
132--   > ** dd
133--   > ee
134--
135-- Read this file and parse to token clauses.
136--
137--   >>> O.printList O.# B.abortLeft O.# readClauses "clause.txt"
138--   CodeClause {clauseLines = ..., clauseTokens = [TText /0.1.0/ TextRaw "aa"]}
139--   CodeClause {clauseLines = ..., clauseTokens = [TText /0.2.0/ TextRaw "bb",
140--                                                  TText /0.3.1/ TextRaw "cc"]}
141--   CodeClause {clauseLines = ..., clauseTokens = [TText /0.6.0/ TextRaw "ee"]}
142--
143readClauses :: (O.Textual t, S.ToTermName t) => FilePath -> B.IOAb [TokenClause t]
144readClauses path =
145    do ls <- readTokenLines path
146       return (tokenClauses <$> ls)
147
148-- | Read clauses and extract tokens.
149readClauseTokens :: (O.Textual t, S.ToTermName t) => FilePath -> B.IOAb [[S.TToken t]]
150readClauseTokens path =
151    do ls <- readClauses path
152       return (B.clauseTokens O.<$$> ls)
153
154
155-- --------------------------------------------  Abbreviation
156
157-- | Abbreviated tokenizer.
158toks :: (O.Textual t, S.ToTermName t) => String -> [S.TToken t]
159toks s = concatMap B.lineTokens $ tokenLinesString (B.codeIxIO s) s
160
161-- | Print token list.
162printToks :: [S.Token] -> IO ()
163printToks ts =
164    do putStrLn $ "********** " ++ (B.cpLineText $ B.getCP ts)
165       mapM_ print ts
166
167-- | Tokenize and print for debug.
168--
169--  Words and quotations.
170--
171--    >>> toksPrint ["aa", "'bb", "\"cc\"", "<dd>", "'/ee", "|012|"]
172--    TText /0.1.0/ TextRaw "aa"
173--    TText /0.2.0/ TextQ "bb"
174--    TText /0.3.0/ TextQQ "cc"
175--    TText /0.4.0/ TextUnk "dd"
176--    TText /0.5.0/ TextTerm "ee"
177--    TText /0.6.0/ TextBar "|012|"
178--
179--  Judgement.
180--
181--    >>> toksPrint ["|-- R  /a A0 /b 31"]
182--    TText /0.1.0/ TextBar "|--"
183--    TSpace /0.1.3/ 1
184--    TText /0.1.4/ TextRaw "R"
185--    TSpace /0.1.5/ 2
186--    TTerm /0.1.7/ "/a"
187--    TSpace /0.1.9/ 1
188--    TText /0.1.10/ TextRaw "A0"
189--    TSpace /0.1.12/ 1
190--    TTerm /0.1.13/ "/b"
191--    TSpace /0.1.15/ 1
192--    TText /0.1.16/ TextRaw "31"
193--  
194--  Brackets.
195--
196--    >>> toksPrint ["aa (bb x y (z))"]
197--    TText /0.1.0/ TextRaw "aa"
198--    TSpace /0.1.2/ 1
199--    TOpen /0.1.3/ "("
200--    TText /0.1.4/ TextRaw "bb"
201--    TSpace /0.1.6/ 1
202--    TText /0.1.7/ TextRaw "x"
203--    TSpace /0.1.8/ 1
204--    TText /0.1.9/ TextRaw "y"
205--    TSpace /0.1.10/ 1
206--    TOpen /0.1.11/ "("
207--    TText /0.1.12/ TextRaw "z"
208--    TClose /0.1.13/ ")"
209--    TClose /0.1.14/ ")"
210--
211--  Comment.
212--
213--    >>> toksPrint ["abc ** this is a comment", "def",""]
214--    TText /0.1.0/ TextRaw "abc"
215--    TSpace /0.1.3/ 1
216--    TComment /0.1.4/ " this is a comment"
217--    TText /0.2.0/ TextRaw "def"
218--
219toksPrint :: [String] -> IO ()
220toksPrint ss = printToks $ toks $ unlines ss
221
222-- | Parse string to clause and print it for inspection.
223--
224--   >>> clausePrint ["|-- A /x 0 /y 1", "", "|== B : ", "  source A /x /y"]
225--   ********** |-- A /x 0 /y 1
226--   TText /0.1.0/ TextBar "|--"
227--   TText /0.1.4/ TextRaw "A"
228--   TTerm /0.1.6/ "/x"
229--   TText /0.1.9/ TextRaw "0"
230--   TTerm /0.1.11/ "/y"
231--   TText /0.1.14/ TextRaw "1"
232--   ********** |== B : 
233--   TText /0.3.0/ TextBar "|=="
234--   TText /0.3.4/ TextRaw "B"
235--   TText /0.3.6/ TextRaw ":"
236--   TText /0.4.2/ TextRaw "source"
237--   TText /0.4.9/ TextRaw "A"
238--   TTerm /0.4.11/ "/x"
239--   TTerm /0.4.14/ "/y"
240--
241clausePrint :: [String] -> IO ()
242clausePrint ss =
243    do let ls = tokenClauses $ tokenLinesString B.def $ unlines ss
244       printToks `mapM_` (B.clauseTokens <$> ls)
245
